  1071→
  1072→# Living Apps API Reference
  1073→
  1074→## ⚠️ Critical API Rules
  1075→
  1076→These rules are **non-negotiable**. Breaking them causes runtime errors.
  1077→
  1078→---
  1079→
  1080→## 1. Date Formats
  1081→
  1082→Living Apps has strict date format requirements:
  1083→
  1084→| Field Type | Format | Example |
  1085→|------------|--------|---------|
  1086→| `date/datetimeminute` | `YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM` | `2025-11-06T12:00` |
  1087→| `date/date` | `YYYY-MM-DD` | `2025-11-06` |
  1088→
  1089→### ❌ WRONG
  1090→```typescript
  1091→// Seconds are NOT allowed for datetimeminute!
  1092→const date = '2025-11-06T12:00:00';  // ❌ Will fail
  1093→```
  1094→
  1095→### ✅ CORRECT
  1096→```typescript
  1097→// For date/datetimeminute fields
  1098→const dateForAPI = formData.datum + 'T12:00';  // ✅ YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM
  1099→
  1100→// For date/date fields
  1101→const dateForAPI = formData.datum;  // ✅ YYYY-MM-DD
  1102→
  1103→// Display in <input type="date">
  1104→const dateForInput = apiData.datum?.split('T')[0];  // Extract YYYY-MM-DD
  1105→```
  1106→
  1107→---
  1108→
  1109→## 2. applookup Fields
  1110→
  1111→`applookup/select` fields store **full URLs** to related records.
  1112→
  1113→### URL Format
  1114→```
  1115→https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1116→```
  1117→
  1118→### ⚠️ CRITICAL: Always use extractRecordId()
  1119→
  1120→```typescript
  1121→// ❌ NEVER do this manually
  1122→const parts = url.split('/');
  1123→const id = parts[parts.length - 1];  // ❌ Fragile!
  1124→
  1125→// ✅ ALWAYS use the helper function
  1126→import { extractRecordId } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1127→
  1128→const recordId = extractRecordId(url);
  1129→if (!recordId) return;  // ✅ Always null-check!
  1130→```
  1131→
  1132→### extractRecordId() Implementation
  1133→```typescript
  1134→export function extractRecordId(url: string | null | undefined): string | null {
  1135→  if (!url) return null;
  1136→  // Extracts last 24 hex characters (Living Apps Record IDs)
  1137→  const match = url.match(/([a-f0-9]{24})$/i);
  1138→  return match ? match[1] : null;
  1139→}
  1140→```
  1141→
  1142→### Creating applookup Values
  1143→```typescript
  1144→import { createRecordUrl, APP_IDS } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1145→
  1146→// When creating/updating records with applookup fields
  1147→const data = {
  1148→  kategorie: createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.KATEGORIEN, selectedKategorieId),
  1149→};
  1150→
  1151→// createRecordUrl returns:
  1152→// 'https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}'
  1153→```
  1154→
  1155→### applookup Can Be Null!
  1156→```typescript
  1157→// ❌ WRONG - Will crash if field is null
  1158→workoutLogs.forEach((log) => {
  1159→  const id = extractRecordId(log.fields.uebung);
  1160→  data[id] = log;  // ❌ Crashes if id is null
  1161→});
  1162→
  1163→// ✅ CORRECT - Defensive programming
  1164→workoutLogs.forEach((log) => {
  1165→  const id = extractRecordId(log.fields.uebung);
  1166→  if (!id) return;  // ✅ Skip if null
  1167→  if (!data[id]) data[id] = [];
  1168→  data[id].push(log);
  1169→});
  1170→```
  1171→
  1172→---
  1173→
  1174→## 3. API Response Format
  1175→
  1176→Living Apps returns **objects**, not arrays!
  1177→
  1178→### Response Structure
  1179→```typescript
  1180→// API returns:
  1181→{
  1182→  "690abc123...": {
  1183→    "createdat": "2025-11-06T10:00:00",
  1184→    "updatedat": null,
  1185→    "fields": {
  1186→      "name": "Item 1",
  1187→      "value": 100
  1188→    }
  1189→  },
  1190→  "690def456...": {
  1191→    "createdat": "2025-11-06T11:00:00",
  1192→    "updatedat": null,
  1193→    "fields": {
  1194→      "name": "Item 2",
  1195→      "value": 200
  1196→    }
  1197→  }
  1198→}
  1199→```
  1200→
  1201→### ❌ WRONG Transformation
  1202→```typescript
  1203→// Loses record_id!
  1204→const items = Object.values(response);  // ❌ No record_id!
  1205→```
  1206→
  1207→### ✅ CORRECT Transformation
  1208→```typescript
  1209→// Use Object.entries() to preserve record_id
  1210→const items = Object.entries(response).map(([record_id, record]) => ({
  1211→  record_id,  // ← From the key
  1212→  createdat: record.createdat,
  1213→  updatedat: record.updatedat,
  1214→  ...record.fields,
  1215→}));
  1216→```
  1217→
  1218→### Why record_id Matters
  1219→- Required for React `key` prop
  1220→- Required for update/delete operations
  1221→- Required for applookup references
  1222→
  1223→---
  1224→
  1225→## 4. API Authentication
  1226→
  1227→```typescript
  1228→const headers = {
  1229→  'X-API-Key': API_KEY,  // From environment
  1230→  'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  1231→  'Accept': 'application/json',
  1232→};
  1233→```
  1234→
  1235→### Proxy vs Direct URL
  1236→```typescript
  1237→// For API calls (via proxy)
  1238→const API_BASE = '/api/rest';
  1239→
  1240→// For applookup values (direct)
  1241→const APPLOOKUP_BASE = 'https://my.living-apps.de/rest';
  1242→```
  1243→
  1244→---
  1245→
  1246→## 5. CRUD Operations
  1247→
  1248→### GET All Records
  1249→```typescript
  1250→GET /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records
  1251→```
  1252→
  1253→### GET Single Record
  1254→```typescript
  1255→GET /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1256→```
  1257→
  1258→### CREATE Record
  1259→```typescript
  1260→POST /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records
  1261→Content-Type: application/json
  1262→
  1263→{
  1264→  "name": "New Item",
  1265→  "value": 100
  1266→}
  1267→```
  1268→
  1269→### UPDATE Record
  1270→```typescript
  1271→PATCH /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1272→Content-Type: application/json
  1273→
  1274→{
  1275→  "value": 150  // Only changed fields
  1276→}
  1277→```
  1278→
  1279→### DELETE Record
  1280→```typescript
  1281→DELETE /api/rest/apps/{app_id}/records/{record_id}
  1282→
  1283→// Note: DELETE also returns JSON, always call response.json()
  1284→```
  1285→
  1286→---
  1287→
  1288→## 6. Error Handling
  1289→
  1290→```typescript
  1291→async function callAPI(method: string, endpoint: string, data?: any) {
  1292→  const response = await fetch(`${API_BASE}${endpoint}`, {
  1293→    method,
  1294→    headers: {
  1295→      'X-API-Key': API_KEY,
  1296→      'Content-Type': 'application/json',
  1297→    },
  1298→    body: data ? JSON.stringify(data) : undefined,
  1299→  });
  1300→
  1301→  if (!response.ok) {
  1302→    const errorText = await response.text();
  1303→    throw new Error(`API Error (${response.status}): ${errorText}`);
  1304→  }
  1305→
  1306→  return response.json();  // Always parse JSON, even for DELETE
  1307→}
  1308→```
  1309→
  1310→---
  1311→
  1312→## 7. Metadata Structure
  1313→
  1314→`app_metadata.json` contains the **complete, real metadata from Living Apps REST API**.
  1315→
  1316→**IMPORTANT:**
  1317→- `controls` is an **OBJECT** (not array!)
  1318→- Each control has `identifier`, `label`, `type`, `subtype`, `fulltype`
  1319→- `lookup/select` has `lookup_data` with all options
  1320→- `applookup/select` has `lookup_app` URL to the linked app
  1321→
  1322→```typescript
  1323→{
  1324→  "appgroup_id": "...",
  1325→  "appgroup_name": "My App Group",
  1326→  "apps": {
  1327→    "app_identifier": {
  1328→      "app_id": "...",
  1329→      "name": "App Display Name",
  1330→      "controls": {
  1331→        "control_identifier": {
  1332→          "identifier": "field_name",      // Use this as field key
  1333→          "label": "Field Label",          // Use this for UI display
  1334→          "type": "string",                // Base type
  1335→          "subtype": null,                 // or "select", "textarea", etc.
  1336→          "fulltype": "string/text",       // Combined: type/subtype
  1337→          "lookup_data": [                 // For lookup/select fields
  1338→            { "key": "option1", "value": "Option 1" },
  1339→            { "key": "option2", "value": "Option 2" }
  1340→          ],
  1341→          "lookup_app": "https://my.living-apps.de/rest/apps/{app_id}"  // For applookup
  1342→        }
  1343→      }
  1344→    }
  1345→  }
  1346→}
  1347→```
  1348→
  1349→### Common Field Types
  1350→| fulltype | TypeScript | Notes |
  1351→|----------|------------|-------|
  1352→| `string/text` | `string` | Plain text |
  1353→| `string/textarea` | `string` | Multiline text |
  1354→| `number/number` | `number` | Numeric |
  1355→| `bool/bool` | `boolean` | True/false |
  1356→| `date/date` | `string` | YYYY-MM-DD |
  1357→| `date/datetimeminute` | `string` | YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM (NO seconds!) |
  1358→| `lookup/select` | `string` | From predefined list (lookup_data) |
  1359→| `applookup/select` | `string \| null` | URL to another app's record |
  1360→
  1361→### Using Metadata for UI
  1362→```typescript
  1363→// Use field labels for UI
  1364→const fieldLabel = metadata.apps.myapp.controls.myfield.label;
  1365→
  1366→// Use lookup_data for Select options
  1367→const options = metadata.apps.myapp.controls.status.lookup_data;
  1368→// → [{ key: "active", value: "Active" }, { key: "done", value: "Done" }]
  1369→```

  1474→
  1475→## TypeScript Patterns
  1476→
  1477→### ⚠️ CRITICAL: Type-Only Imports
  1478→
  1479→TypeScript's `verbatimModuleSyntax` requires explicit type imports:
  1480→
  1481→```typescript
  1482→// ❌ WRONG - TypeScript error
  1483→import { Workout, Ernaehrung } from '@/types/app';
  1484→
  1485→// ✅ CORRECT - Option 1 (preferred)
  1486→import type { Workout, Ernaehrung } from '@/types/app';
  1487→
  1488→// ✅ CORRECT - Option 2
  1489→import { type Workout, type Ernaehrung } from '@/types/app';
  1490→```
  1491→
  1492→---
  1493→
  1494→## Data Fetching Pattern
  1495→
  1496→```typescript
  1497→import { useState, useEffect } from 'react';
  1498→import type { Workout } from '@/types/app';
  1499→import { LivingAppsService } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1500→
  1501→function Dashboard() {
  1502→  const [data, setData] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
  1503→  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(true);
  1504→  const [error, setError] = useState<Error | null>(null);
  1505→
  1506→  useEffect(() => {
  1507→    async function fetchData() {
  1508→      try {
  1509→        setLoading(true);
  1510→        const result = await LivingAppsService.getWorkouts();
  1511→        setData(result);
  1512→      } catch (err) {
  1513→        setError(err instanceof Error ? err : new Error('Unknown error'));
  1514→      } finally {
  1515→        setLoading(false);
  1516→      }
  1517→    }
  1518→    fetchData();
  1519→  }, []);
  1520→
  1521→  if (loading) return <LoadingState />;
  1522→  if (error) return <ErrorState error={error} onRetry={() => window.location.reload()} />;
  1523→  if (data.length === 0) return <EmptyState />;
  1524→
  1525→  return <DashboardContent data={data} />;
  1526→}
  1527→```
  1528→
  1529→---
  1530→
  1531→## Relationship Handling (applookup)
  1532→
  1533→### Joining Data from Multiple Apps
  1534→
  1535→```typescript
  1536→import type { Workout, Exercise } from '@/types/app';
  1537→import { extractRecordId } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1538→
  1539→function useDashboardData() {
  1540→  const [workouts, setWorkouts] = useState<Workout[]>([]);
  1541→  const [exercises, setExercises] = useState<Exercise[]>([]);
  1542→
  1543→  useEffect(() => {
  1544→    async function load() {
  1545→      const [w, e] = await Promise.all([
  1546→        LivingAppsService.getWorkouts(),
  1547→        LivingAppsService.getExercises(),
  1548→      ]);
  1549→      setWorkouts(w);
  1550→      setExercises(e);
  1551→    }
  1552→    load();
  1553→  }, []);
  1554→
  1555→  // Create lookup map for exercises
  1556→  const exerciseMap = useMemo(() => {
  1557→    const map = new Map<string, Exercise>();
  1558→    exercises.forEach(ex => map.set(ex.record_id, ex));
  1559→    return map;
  1560→  }, [exercises]);
  1561→
  1562→  // Enrich workouts with exercise data
  1563→  const enrichedWorkouts = useMemo(() => {
  1564→    return workouts.map(workout => {
  1565→      const exerciseId = extractRecordId(workout.fields.exercise);
  1566→      const exercise = exerciseId ? exerciseMap.get(exerciseId) : null;
  1567→      return { ...workout, exercise };
  1568→    });
  1569→  }, [workouts, exerciseMap]);
  1570→
  1571→  return { enrichedWorkouts, loading, error };
  1572→}
  1573→```
  1574→
  1575→### Grouping by Relationship
  1576→
  1577→```typescript
  1578→// Group items by a related record
  1579→function groupByRelation<T extends { fields: { [key: string]: any } }>(
  1580→  items: T[],
  1581→  relationField: string
  1582→): Map<string, T[]> {
  1583→  const groups = new Map<string, T[]>();
  1584→  
  1585→  items.forEach(item => {
  1586→    const relatedId = extractRecordId(item.fields[relationField]);
  1587→    if (!relatedId) return;  // ✅ Skip items without relation
  1588→    
  1589→    if (!groups.has(relatedId)) {
  1590→      groups.set(relatedId, []);
  1591→    }
  1592→    groups.get(relatedId)!.push(item);
  1593→  });
  1594→  
  1595→  return groups;
  1596→}
  1597→
  1598→// Usage
  1599→const workoutsByExercise = groupByRelation(workouts, 'exercise');
  1600→```
  1601→
  1602→---
  1603→
  1604→## Form Handling Pattern
  1605→
  1606→```typescript
  1607→import { useState } from 'react';
  1608→import type { WorkoutInput } from '@/types/app';
  1609→import { LivingAppsService, createRecordUrl, APP_IDS } from '@/services/livingAppsService';
  1610→
  1611→function AddWorkoutForm({ onSuccess }: { onSuccess: () => void }) {
  1612→  const [formData, setFormData] = useState<Partial<WorkoutInput>>({});
  1613→  const [submitting, setSubmitting] = useState(false);
  1614→
  1615→  async function handleSubmit(e: React.FormEvent) {
  1616→    e.preventDefault();
  1617→    setSubmitting(true);
  1618→
  1619→    try {
  1620→      // Transform data for API
  1621→      const apiData = {
  1622→        ...formData,
  1623→        // Date format: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM (no seconds!)
  1624→        datum: formData.datum + 'T12:00',
  1625→        // applookup: full URL
  1626→        exercise: formData.exerciseId 
  1627→          ? createRecordUrl(APP_IDS.EXERCISES, formData.exerciseId)
  1628→          : null,
  1629→      };
  1630→
  1631→      await LivingAppsService.createWorkout(apiData);
  1632→      onSuccess();
  1633→    } catch (err) {
  1634→      console.error('Failed to create:', err);
  1635→    } finally {
  1636→      setSubmitting(false);
  1637→    }
  1638→  }
  1639→
  1640→  return (
  1641→    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit}>
  1642→      {/* Form fields */}
  1643→    </form>
  1644→  );
  1645→}
  1646→```

  1650→## shadcn/ui Component Patterns
  1651→
  1652→### Card with Stats
  1653→
  1654→```typescript
  1655→import { Card, CardContent, CardHeader, CardTitle } from '@/components/ui/card';
  1656→
  1657→function StatCard({ title, value, icon: Icon }: StatProps) {

  1659→    <Card>
  1660→      <CardHeader className="flex flex-row items-center justify-between pb-2">
  1661→        <CardTitle className="text-sm font-medium text-muted-foreground">
  1662→          {title}
  1663→        </CardTitle>
  1664→        {Icon && <Icon className="h-4 w-4 text-muted-foreground" />}
  1665→      </CardHeader>
  1666→      <CardContent>
  1667→        <div className="text-2xl font-bold">{value}</div>
  1668→      </CardContent>
  1669→    </Card>

  1673→
  1674→### ⚠️ Select Component - No Empty Strings!
  1675→
  1676→```typescript
  1677→// ❌ WRONG - Runtime error!
  1678→<SelectItem value="">No selection</SelectItem>
  1679→
  1680→// ✅ CORRECT - Use placeholder
  1681→<Select value={value} onValueChange={setValue}>
  1682→  <SelectTrigger>
  1683→    <SelectValue placeholder="Select option..." />
  1684→  </SelectTrigger>
  1685→  <SelectContent>
  1686→    <SelectItem value="option1">Option 1</SelectItem>
  1687→    <SelectItem value="option2">Option 2</SelectItem>
  1688→  </SelectContent>
  1689→</Select>
  1690→
  1691→// ✅ CORRECT - Use special value for "none"
  1692→<Select value={value || "none"} onValueChange={v => setValue(v === "none" ? "" : v)}>
  1693→  <SelectTrigger>
  1694→    <SelectValue />
  1695→  </SelectTrigger>
  1696→  <SelectContent>
  1697→    <SelectItem value="none">No selection</SelectItem>
  1698→    <SelectItem value="option1">Option 1</SelectItem>
  1699→  </SelectContent>
  1700→</Select>
  1701→```
  1702→
  1703→### Dialog for Actions
  1704→
  1705→```typescript
  1706→import {
  1707→  Dialog,

  1709→  DialogHeader,

  1713→
  1714→function ActionDialog({ trigger, title, children }: DialogProps) {
  1715→  const [open, setOpen] = useState(false);
  1716→
  1717→  return (
  1718→    <Dialog open={open} onOpenChange={setOpen}>
  1719→      <DialogTrigger asChild>
  1720→        {trigger}
  1721→      </DialogTrigger>
  1722→      <DialogContent className="sm:max-w-md">

  1724→          <DialogTitle>{title}</DialogTitle>
  1725→        </DialogHeader>
  1726→        {children}
  1727→      </DialogContent>
  1728→    </Dialog>
  1729→  );
  1730→}

  1735→## Chart Patterns (recharts)
  1736→
  1737→### Basic Line Chart
  1738→
  1739→```typescript
  1740→import { LineChart, Line, XAxis, YAxis, Tooltip, ResponsiveContainer } from 'recharts';
  1741→
  1742→function TrendChart({ data }: { data: Array<{ name: string; value: number }> }) {
  1743→  return (
  1744→    <div className="h-[300px]">
  1745→      <ResponsiveContainer width="100%" height="100%">
  1746→        <LineChart data={data}>
  1747→          <XAxis 
  1748→            dataKey="name" 
  1749→            tick={{ fontSize: 12 }}
  1750→            stroke="hsl(var(--muted-foreground))"
  1751→          />
  1752→          <YAxis 
  1753→            tick={{ fontSize: 12 }}
  1754→            stroke="hsl(var(--muted-foreground))"
  1755→          />
  1756→          <Tooltip 
  1757→            contentStyle={{ 
  1758→              backgroundColor: 'hsl(var(--background))',
  1759→              border: '1px solid hsl(var(--border))',
  1760→            }}
  1761→          />
  1762→          <Line 
  1763→            type="monotone" 
  1764→            dataKey="value" 
  1765→            stroke="hsl(var(--primary))"
  1766→            strokeWidth={2}
  1767→            dot={false}
  1768→          />
  1769→        </LineChart>
  1770→      </ResponsiveContainer>
  1771→    </div>
  1772→  );
  1773→}
  1774→```
  1775→
  1776→### Data Aggregation for Charts
  1777→
  1778→```typescript
  1779→// Group by date
  1780→function aggregateByDate<T extends { createdat: string }>(
  1781→  items: T[],
  1782→  valueExtractor: (item: T) => number
  1783→): Array<{ date: string; value: number }> {
  1784→  const groups = new Map<string, number>();
  1785→  
  1786→  items.forEach(item => {
  1787→    const date = item.createdat.split('T')[0];  // YYYY-MM-DD
  1788→    const current = groups.get(date) || 0;
  1789→    groups.set(date, current + valueExtractor(item));
  1790→  });
  1791→  
  1792→  return Array.from(groups.entries())
  1793→    .map(([date, value]) => ({ date, value }))
  1794→    .sort((a, b) => a.date.localeCompare(b.date));
  1795→}
  1796→```

  1800→## Date Formatting (date-fns)
  1801→
  1802→```typescript
  1803→import { format, parseISO, formatDistance } from 'date-fns';
  1804→import { de } from 'date-fns/locale';
  1805→
  1806→// Format for display
  1807→const formatted = format(parseISO(record.createdat), 'dd.MM.yyyy', { locale: de });
  1808→// → "06.11.2025"
  1809→
  1810→// Relative time
  1811→const relative = formatDistance(parseISO(record.createdat), new Date(), { 
  1812→  addSuffix: true,
  1813→  locale: de 
  1814→});
  1815→// → "vor 3 Tagen"
  1816→
  1817→// For input type="date"
  1818→const inputValue = record.datum?.split('T')[0] || '';
  1819→// → "2025-11-06"
  1820→```

  1823→
  1824→## Utility Functions
  1825→
  1826→### Safe Number Formatting
  1827→
  1828→```typescript
  1829→function formatNumber(value: number | null | undefined): string {
  1830→  if (value == null) return '-';
  1831→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE').format(value);
  1832→}
  1833→
  1834→function formatCurrency(value: number | null | undefined): string {
  1835→  if (value == null) return '-';
  1836→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE', {
  1837→    style: 'currency',
  1838→    currency: 'EUR',
  1839→  }).format(value);
  1840→}
  1841→
  1842→function formatPercent(value: number | null | undefined): string {
  1843→  if (value == null) return '-';
  1844→  return new Intl.NumberFormat('de-DE', {
  1845→    style: 'percent',
  1846→    minimumFractionDigits: 1,
  1847→  }).format(value / 100);
  1848→}
  1849→```
  1850→
  1851→### Calculate KPIs
  1852→
  1853→```typescript
  1854→function calculateStats<T>(
  1855→  items: T[],
  1856→  valueExtractor: (item: T) => number | null | undefined
  1857→) {
  1858→  const values = items
  1859→    .map(valueExtractor)
  1860→    .filter((v): v is number => v != null);
  1861→  
  1862→  if (values.length === 0) {
  1863→    return { sum: 0, avg: 0, min: 0, max: 0, count: 0 };
  1864→  }
  1865→  
  1866→  return {
  1867→    sum: values.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0),
  1868→    avg: values.reduce((a, b) => a + b, 0) / values.length,
  1869→    min: Math.min(...values),
  1870→    max: Math.max(...values),
  1871→    count: values.length,
  1872→  };
  1873→}
  1874→```

input.content:
# Design Brief: Kursverwaltung

## 1. App Analysis

### What This App Does
Kursverwaltung is a course management system for educational institutions or training providers. It manages courses (Kurse), instructors (Dozenten), rooms (Räume), participants (Teilnehmer), and enrollments/registrations (Anmeldungen). The system tracks which participants are enrolled in which courses, which instructor teaches which course, in which room, and whether payment has been received.

### Who Uses This
An administrative coordinator or office manager at a training center, school, or Volkshochschule. They are not technical — they manage courses, assign rooms and instructors, register participants, and track payments. They need quick access to "what's happening" across all courses.

### The ONE Thing Users Care About Most
**How many registrations are there across active courses, and how is payment status?** The user opens the dashboard to see at a glance: total enrollments, how many paid vs. unpaid, and which courses are filling up. This is their daily pulse check.

### Primary Actions (IMPORTANT!)
1. **Neue Anmeldung** → Primary Action Button — Register a participant for a course (this is the #1 daily task)
2. Neuen Kurs erstellen — Add a new course
3. Neuen Teilnehmer hinzufügen — Add a new participant

---

## 2. What Makes This Design Distinctive

### Visual Identity
The design uses a refined indigo-slate color palette with warm paper-white backgrounds. The accent color is a rich indigo (`hsl(243 55% 54%)`) — academic, trustworthy, and distinctive without being corporate blue. Cards float with subtle shadows on a warm off-white canvas, creating depth. The overall feel is "a well-organized academic planner" — structured but inviting.

### Layout Strategy
- The hero element is an asymmetric banner showing total Anmeldungen count with a payment status breakdown (paid vs. unpaid as a visual bar). It spans the full width and is visually dominant through size and an indigo gradient accent line.
- The layout is **asymmetric on desktop**: a wide left column (2/3) holds the hero + course overview chart, while a narrow right column (1/3) shows recent activity and quick stats.
- Visual interest comes from: varying card sizes (hero is 2x height of secondary KPIs), a subtle gradient accent on the hero, and typography weight contrast between the large hero number and small labels.
- Secondary KPI cards are compact and inline below the hero, creating a rhythm break.

### Unique Element
The hero KPI features a horizontal segmented bar showing paid vs. unpaid ratio — filled in indigo for paid and a muted warm tone for unpaid. This makes the payment status instantly visual without needing a pie chart. The bar has rounded caps and is 12px tall, sitting right below the big enrollment number.

---

## 3. Theme & Colors

### Font
- **Family:** Plus Jakarta Sans
- **URL:** `https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Plus+Jakarta+Sans:wght@300;400;500;600;700;800&display=swap`
- **Why this font:** Professional, modern, and warm — it has geometric precision with subtle rounded terminals that feel approachable for non-technical users. It creates clear hierarchy through its wide weight range (300-800).

### Color Palette
All colors as complete hsl() functions:

| Purpose | Color | CSS Variable |
|---------|-------|--------------|
| Page background | `hsl(40 25% 97%)` | `--background` |
| Main text | `hsl(230 25% 15%)` | `--foreground` |
| Card background | `hsl(0 0% 100%)` | `--card` |
| Card text | `hsl(230 25% 15%)` | `--card-foreground` |
| Borders | `hsl(230 15% 90%)` | `--border` |
| Primary action | `hsl(243 55% 54%)` | `--primary` |
| Text on primary | `hsl(0 0% 100%)` | `--primary-foreground` |
| Accent highlight | `hsl(243 40% 95%)` | `--accent` |
| Muted background | `hsl(230 20% 95%)` | `--muted` |
| Muted text | `hsl(230 10% 50%)` | `--muted-foreground` |
| Success/positive | `hsl(152 55% 42%)` | (component use) |
| Error/negative | `hsl(0 72% 51%)` | `--destructive` |

### Why These Colors
The warm off-white background (`hsl(40 25% 97%)`) avoids clinical coolness. The indigo primary (`hsl(243 55% 54%)`) is academic and distinguished — it signals authority without coldness. The muted slate tones for text create comfortable reading. Green for "bezahlt" (paid) and the destructive red for unpaid/delete creates intuitive status coding.

### Background Treatment
Warm off-white (`hsl(40 25% 97%)`) — not pure white, not gray. This gives the page a subtle warmth like quality paper. Cards are pure white to create gentle lift.

---

## 4. Mobile Layout (Phone)

### Layout Approach
The hero dominates the first viewport fold. Below it, secondary KPIs stack vertically as compact rows (not cards). The chart becomes a simplified horizontal bar chart. Lists are touch-friendly card stacks.

### What Users See (Top to Bottom)

**Header:**
App title "Kursverwaltung" in 20px font-weight-700, left-aligned. No subtitle needed.

**Hero Section (The FIRST thing users see):**
- Full-width card with 24px padding
- Large number showing total Anmeldungen count in 48px font-weight-800
- Label "Anmeldungen gesamt" in 13px font-weight-400 muted text above the number
- Below the number: a 12px-tall horizontal segmented bar showing bezahlt (indigo) vs. unbezahlt (muted) ratio
- Below the bar: inline text "X bezahlt · Y offen" in 13px
- Takes approximately 30% of viewport height
- Why: The coordinator needs to know enrollment status at a glance — this answers "how are we doing?"

**Section 2: Quick Stats Row**
- Horizontal scrollable row of 3 compact stat pills (not full cards):
  - Aktive Kurse (count)
  - Dozenten (count)
  - Freie Plätze (calculated: sum of maximale_teilnehmer - current registrations)
- Each pill: muted background, 14px bold number, 11px label below
- This provides context without taking much vertical space

**Section 3: Kurse Übersicht**
- List of courses as cards, each showing:
  - Kurstitel (16px font-weight-600)
  - Dozent name + Raum name (13px muted)
  - Startdatum - Enddatum (13px muted)
  - Badge showing "X/Y Plätze" (enrollment count / max)
  - Badge color: green if <80% full, yellow if 80-99%, red if 100%
- Sorted by startdatum (soonest first)
- Show max 5, with "Alle anzeigen" link navigating to /kurse

**Section 4: Letzte Anmeldungen**
- Last 5 registrations as simple list items
- Each: Teilnehmer name + Kursname + date
- Badge for bezahlt status (green "Bezahlt" / yellow "Offen")

**Bottom Navigation:**
Fixed bottom tab bar with 5 tabs (icons + labels):
1. Home (LayoutDashboard icon) → /
2. Kurse (GraduationCap icon) → /kurse
3. Dozenten (Users icon) → /dozenten
4. Teilnehmer (UserCheck icon) → /teilnehmer
5. Räume (DoorOpen icon) → /raeume

Note: Anmeldungen is accessed from within Kurse context or via the primary action button, not as a separate tab (to keep mobile tabs at 5 max).

### Mobile-Specific Adaptations
- Hero is full-width, no side margins on the card
- Stats are horizontal scrollable pills instead of grid
- Course list cards stack vertically with 12px gap
- Chart is omitted on mobile to save space — the segmented bar in the hero provides the visual summary
- Bottom padding of 80px to avoid content hidden behind bottom nav

### Touch Targets
- All list items minimum 48px height
- Bottom tab icons 24px with 44px hit area
- Primary action button (FAB) is 56px circular, positioned bottom-right above the nav bar

### Interactive Elements
- Course cards tap to navigate to /kurse (filtered to that course)
- Anmeldung items tap to show detail in a bottom sheet

---

## 5. Desktop Layout

### Overall Structure
Two-column layout: 65% left / 35% right, with a max-width of 1400px centered.

**Eye flow:** Hero (top-left, spanning left column) → Quick stats (below hero, left) → Course chart (left) → Recent activity (right column, top) → Quick actions (right column).

### Section Layout

**Top area (full width):**
- Page title "Kursverwaltung" (28px, font-weight-800) with primary action button "Neue Anmeldung" on the right

**Left column (65%):**
1. **Hero Card** — Total Anmeldungen with payment bar (same as mobile but wider, number at 56px)
2. **Quick Stats Row** — 3 stat cards side by side (Aktive Kurse, Dozenten, Freie Plätze)
3. **Anmeldungen Trend Chart** — Bar chart showing registrations per course (horizontal bars, sorted by count descending). X-axis: count, Y-axis: course name. This answers "which courses are most popular?"

**Right column (35%):**
1. **Letzte Anmeldungen** — Last 8 registrations with participant name, course, date, payment badge
2. **Kurse mit freien Plätzen** — Courses that still have availability, with progress bar showing fill rate

### What Appears on Hover
- Course cards: subtle shadow increase + slight translateY(-1px)
- Table rows: muted background highlight
- Stat cards: slight shadow increase

### Clickable/Interactive Areas
- Course names → navigate to /kurse
- Participant names in recent list → navigate to /teilnehmer
- "Alle anzeigen" links on each section → navigate to respective page

---

## 6. Components

### Hero KPI
- **Title:** Anmeldungen gesamt
- **Data source:** Anmeldungen app (count all records)
- **Calculation:** Count of all Anmeldungen records
- **Display:** Large number (48px mobile, 56px desktop, font-weight-800) with segmented horizontal bar below showing bezahlt ratio
- **Context shown:** Bezahlt vs. Offen count, displayed as colored segments in horizontal bar + inline text
- **Why this is the hero:** The coordinator's #1 question every day is "how many enrollments do we have and are they paid?"

### Secondary KPIs

**Aktive Kurse**
- Source: Kurse app
- Calculation: Count of all Kurse records (or filter by date if startdatum <= today <= enddatum)
- Format: number
- Display: Compact stat card, 24px bold number, 12px muted label

**Dozenten**
- Source: Dozenten app
- Calculation: Count of all Dozenten records
- Format: number
- Display: Compact stat card

**Freie Plätze**
- Source: Kurse (maximale_teilnehmer) cross-referenced with Anmeldungen (count per kurs)
- Calculation: Sum of (maximale_teilnehmer - anmeldungen_count) for each Kurs
- Format: number
- Display: Compact stat card

### Chart
- **Type:** Horizontal bar chart — WHY: comparing course popularity is best done with named bars, and horizontal allows longer course names
- **Title:** Anmeldungen pro Kurs
- **What question it answers:** Which courses are most popular / filling up fastest?
- **Data source:** Anmeldungen grouped by kurs (applookup), joined with Kurse for names
- **X-axis:** Count of Anmeldungen
- **Y-axis:** Kurstitel (course name)
- **Colors:** Bars in primary color (indigo), with max capacity shown as a light background bar
- **Mobile simplification:** Hidden on mobile — the hero segmented bar provides the at-a-glance summary instead

### Lists/Tables

**Letzte Anmeldungen**
- Purpose: See most recent activity — who registered for what
- Source: Anmeldungen joined with Teilnehmer (name) and Kurse (title)
- Fields shown: Teilnehmer name, Kurstitel, Anmeldedatum, Bezahlt status (badge)
- Mobile style: Simple list with dividers
- Desktop style: Clean list in a card
- Sort: By anmeldedatum descending (newest first)
- Limit: 5 on mobile, 8 on desktop

**Kurse mit freien Plätzen (Desktop only sidebar)**
- Purpose: Quick view of which courses still have capacity
- Source: Kurse joined with Anmeldungen count
- Fields shown: Kurstitel, fill progress bar (enrolled/max), available spots count
- Desktop style: Compact list in card
- Sort: By available spots ascending (almost full first)
- Limit: 5

### Primary Action Button (REQUIRED!)
- **Label:** "Neue Anmeldung"
- **Action:** add_record
- **Target app:** Anmeldungen
- **What data:** Teilnehmer (select from existing), Kurs (select from existing), Anmeldedatum (date, default today), Bezahlt (checkbox, default false)
- **Mobile position:** fab (floating action button, bottom-right, 56px, above bottom nav)
- **Desktop position:** header (top-right, inline with page title)
- **Why this action:** Registering participants for courses is the #1 daily task for the coordinator

### CRUD Operations Per App (REQUIRED!)

**Kurse CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "+" button on /kurse page header opens Dialog. Fields: Kurstitel (text, required), Beschreibung (textarea), Startdatum (date), Enddatum (date), Maximale Teilnehmerzahl (number), Preis EUR (number), Dozent (select from Dozenten app), Raum (select from Räume app). Default: Startdatum = today.
- **Read:** Card list sorted by Startdatum (soonest first). Each card: Kurstitel, Beschreibung truncated, date range, Dozent name, Raum name, enrollment badge. Click card → Detail Dialog showing all fields + list of enrolled participants.
- **Update:** Pencil icon in detail view → same Dialog as Create, pre-filled with current values.
- **Delete:** Trash icon in detail view → Confirmation: "Möchtest du den Kurs '{titel}' wirklich löschen?"

**Räume CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "+" button on /raeume page header opens Dialog. Fields: Raumname (text, required), Gebäude (text), Kapazität (number).
- **Read:** Table with columns: Raumname, Gebäude, Kapazität. Click row → Detail Dialog.
- **Update:** Pencil icon in detail view or row → same Dialog as Create, pre-filled.
- **Delete:** Trash icon → Confirmation: "Möchtest du den Raum '{raumname}' wirklich löschen?"

**Dozenten CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "+" button on /dozenten page header opens Dialog. Fields: Vorname (text, required), Nachname (text, required), E-Mail (email), Telefon (tel), Fachgebiet (text).
- **Read:** Card grid (2 cols desktop, 1 col mobile). Each card: Full name, Fachgebiet badge, Email, Telefon. Click → Detail Dialog with all fields + list of their courses.
- **Update:** Pencil icon in detail/card → same Dialog as Create, pre-filled.
- **Delete:** Trash icon → Confirmation: "Möchtest du den Dozenten '{vorname} {nachname}' wirklich löschen?"

**Teilnehmer CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "+" button on /teilnehmer page header opens Dialog. Fields: Vorname (text, required), Nachname (text, required), E-Mail (email), Telefon (tel), Geburtsdatum (date).
- **Read:** Table with columns: Name (Vorname + Nachname), E-Mail, Telefon, Geburtsdatum. Searchable by name. Click row → Detail Dialog with all fields + list of their enrollments.
- **Update:** Pencil icon → same Dialog as Create, pre-filled.
- **Delete:** Trash icon → Confirmation: "Möchtest du den Teilnehmer '{vorname} {nachname}' wirklich löschen?"

**Anmeldungen CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** Primary action "Neue Anmeldung" (FAB on mobile, header button on desktop). Dialog fields: Teilnehmer (select from Teilnehmer app, required), Kurs (select from Kurse app, required), Anmeldedatum (date, default today), Bezahlt (checkbox, default false).
- **Read:** Accessed via /kurse detail or dashboard. Table/list: Teilnehmer name, Kurs name, Anmeldedatum, Bezahlt badge. Sortable by date.
- **Update:** Pencil icon → same Dialog, pre-filled. Main use case: toggling bezahlt status.
- **Delete:** Trash icon → Confirmation: "Möchtest du die Anmeldung von '{teilnehmer_name}' für '{kurs_name}' wirklich löschen?"

---

## 7. Navigation (React Router)

### Navigation Structure
- **Navigation style:** Sidebar (desktop) + Bottom tabs (mobile)
- **Dashboard/Home route:** Overview KPIs, hero enrollment stats, recent activity, quick actions

### Routes

| Route | Page | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `/` | Dashboard Overview | Hero KPI, quick stats, trend chart, recent anmeldungen |
| `/kurse` | Kurse | Full CRUD list of all courses with enrollment counts |
| `/dozenten` | Dozenten | Full CRUD card grid of all instructors |
| `/teilnehmer` | Teilnehmer | Full CRUD searchable table of all participants |
| `/raeume` | Räume | Full CRUD table of all rooms |

Anmeldungen are managed inline: from the dashboard FAB, from within Kurse detail views, and from a dedicated section on the dashboard. No separate /anmeldungen route needed — they are always in context of a Kurs or Teilnehmer.

### Navigation Design

**Desktop:**
- Fixed left sidebar, 260px wide, white background with border-right
- App logo/title "Kursverwaltung" at top with a small GraduationCap icon
- Nav items stacked vertically with icon + label
- Active item: indigo background (`--primary`) with white text
- Inactive items: muted-foreground text, hover shows muted background
- Sidebar is always visible (not collapsible)

**Mobile:**
- Fixed bottom tab bar, white background with border-top
- 5 tabs with icon (20px) + label (11px) stacked vertically
- Tabs: Übersicht, Kurse, Dozenten, Teilnehmer, Räume
- Icons: LayoutDashboard, GraduationCap, Users, UserCheck, DoorOpen

### Active Route Indicator
- Desktop: Active nav item has `bg-primary text-primary-foreground` with rounded-lg
- Mobile: Active tab icon and label in primary color, inactive in muted-foreground

### Dashboard Overview Page (/)
- Hero KPI (Anmeldungen + payment bar)
- 3 quick stat cards (Aktive Kurse, Dozenten, Freie Plätze)
- Anmeldungen pro Kurs chart (desktop only)
- Letzte Anmeldungen list
- Kurse mit freien Plätzen (desktop sidebar column)

---

## 8. Visual Details

### Border Radius
Rounded (8px) — `--radius: 0.5rem`. Cards and buttons feel modern but not overly playful.

### Shadows
Subtle — Cards: `shadow-sm` (0 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.05)). On hover: `shadow-md` transition. The hero card has `shadow-md` by default to elevate it.

### Spacing
Normal to spacious — 24px gap between major sections, 16px gap between cards in a grid, 12px internal padding on compact elements, 24px on larger cards.

### Animations
- **Page load:** Stagger fade-in for cards (opacity 0→1, translateY 8px→0, 200ms, stagger 50ms)
- **Page transitions:** Fade (150ms opacity transition between routes)
- **Hover effects:** Cards lift with shadow-md + translateY(-1px), 150ms ease

toolUseResult.content:
# Design Brief: Kursverwaltung

## 1. App Analysis

### What This App Does
Kursverwaltung is a course management system for educational institutions or training providers. It manages courses (Kurse), instructors (Dozenten), rooms (Räume), participants (Teilnehmer), and enrollments/registrations (Anmeldungen). The system tracks which participants are enrolled in which courses, which instructor teaches which course, in which room, and whether payment has been received.

### Who Uses This
An administrative coordinator or office manager at a training center, school, or Volkshochschule. They are not technical — they manage courses, assign rooms and instructors, register participants, and track payments. They need quick access to "what's happening" across all courses.

### The ONE Thing Users Care About Most
**How many registrations are there across active courses, and how is payment status?** The user opens the dashboard to see at a glance: total enrollments, how many paid vs. unpaid, and which courses are filling up. This is their daily pulse check.

### Primary Actions (IMPORTANT!)
1. **Neue Anmeldung** → Primary Action Button — Register a participant for a course (this is the #1 daily task)
2. Neuen Kurs erstellen — Add a new course
3. Neuen Teilnehmer hinzufügen — Add a new participant

---

## 2. What Makes This Design Distinctive

### Visual Identity
The design uses a refined indigo-slate color palette with warm paper-white backgrounds. The accent color is a rich indigo (`hsl(243 55% 54%)`) — academic, trustworthy, and distinctive without being corporate blue. Cards float with subtle shadows on a warm off-white canvas, creating depth. The overall feel is "a well-organized academic planner" — structured but inviting.

### Layout Strategy
- The hero element is an asymmetric banner showing total Anmeldungen count with a payment status breakdown (paid vs. unpaid as a visual bar). It spans the full width and is visually dominant through size and an indigo gradient accent line.
- The layout is **asymmetric on desktop**: a wide left column (2/3) holds the hero + course overview chart, while a narrow right column (1/3) shows recent activity and quick stats.
- Visual interest comes from: varying card sizes (hero is 2x height of secondary KPIs), a subtle gradient accent on the hero, and typography weight contrast between the large hero number and small labels.
- Secondary KPI cards are compact and inline below the hero, creating a rhythm break.

### Unique Element
The hero KPI features a horizontal segmented bar showing paid vs. unpaid ratio — filled in indigo for paid and a muted warm tone for unpaid. This makes the payment status instantly visual without needing a pie chart. The bar has rounded caps and is 12px tall, sitting right below the big enrollment number.

---

## 3. Theme & Colors

### Font
- **Family:** Plus Jakarta Sans
- **URL:** `https://fonts.googleapis.com/css2?family=Plus+Jakarta+Sans:wght@300;400;500;600;700;800&display=swap`
- **Why this font:** Professional, modern, and warm — it has geometric precision with subtle rounded terminals that feel approachable for non-technical users. It creates clear hierarchy through its wide weight range (300-800).

### Color Palette
All colors as complete hsl() functions:

| Purpose | Color | CSS Variable |
|---------|-------|--------------|
| Page background | `hsl(40 25% 97%)` | `--background` |
| Main text | `hsl(230 25% 15%)` | `--foreground` |
| Card background | `hsl(0 0% 100%)` | `--card` |
| Card text | `hsl(230 25% 15%)` | `--card-foreground` |
| Borders | `hsl(230 15% 90%)` | `--border` |
| Primary action | `hsl(243 55% 54%)` | `--primary` |
| Text on primary | `hsl(0 0% 100%)` | `--primary-foreground` |
| Accent highlight | `hsl(243 40% 95%)` | `--accent` |
| Muted background | `hsl(230 20% 95%)` | `--muted` |
| Muted text | `hsl(230 10% 50%)` | `--muted-foreground` |
| Success/positive | `hsl(152 55% 42%)` | (component use) |
| Error/negative | `hsl(0 72% 51%)` | `--destructive` |

### Why These Colors
The warm off-white background (`hsl(40 25% 97%)`) avoids clinical coolness. The indigo primary (`hsl(243 55% 54%)`) is academic and distinguished — it signals authority without coldness. The muted slate tones for text create comfortable reading. Green for "bezahlt" (paid) and the destructive red for unpaid/delete creates intuitive status coding.

### Background Treatment
Warm off-white (`hsl(40 25% 97%)`) — not pure white, not gray. This gives the page a subtle warmth like quality paper. Cards are pure white to create gentle lift.

---

## 4. Mobile Layout (Phone)

### Layout Approach
The hero dominates the first viewport fold. Below it, secondary KPIs stack vertically as compact rows (not cards). The chart becomes a simplified horizontal bar chart. Lists are touch-friendly card stacks.

### What Users See (Top to Bottom)

**Header:**
App title "Kursverwaltung" in 20px font-weight-700, left-aligned. No subtitle needed.

**Hero Section (The FIRST thing users see):**
- Full-width card with 24px padding
- Large number showing total Anmeldungen count in 48px font-weight-800
- Label "Anmeldungen gesamt" in 13px font-weight-400 muted text above the number
- Below the number: a 12px-tall horizontal segmented bar showing bezahlt (indigo) vs. unbezahlt (muted) ratio
- Below the bar: inline text "X bezahlt · Y offen" in 13px
- Takes approximately 30% of viewport height
- Why: The coordinator needs to know enrollment status at a glance — this answers "how are we doing?"

**Section 2: Quick Stats Row**
- Horizontal scrollable row of 3 compact stat pills (not full cards):
  - Aktive Kurse (count)
  - Dozenten (count)
  - Freie Plätze (calculated: sum of maximale_teilnehmer - current registrations)
- Each pill: muted background, 14px bold number, 11px label below
- This provides context without taking much vertical space

**Section 3: Kurse Übersicht**
- List of courses as cards, each showing:
  - Kurstitel (16px font-weight-600)
  - Dozent name + Raum name (13px muted)
  - Startdatum - Enddatum (13px muted)
  - Badge showing "X/Y Plätze" (enrollment count / max)
  - Badge color: green if <80% full, yellow if 80-99%, red if 100%
- Sorted by startdatum (soonest first)
- Show max 5, with "Alle anzeigen" link navigating to /kurse

**Section 4: Letzte Anmeldungen**
- Last 5 registrations as simple list items
- Each: Teilnehmer name + Kursname + date
- Badge for bezahlt status (green "Bezahlt" / yellow "Offen")

**Bottom Navigation:**
Fixed bottom tab bar with 5 tabs (icons + labels):
1. Home (LayoutDashboard icon) → /
2. Kurse (GraduationCap icon) → /kurse
3. Dozenten (Users icon) → /dozenten
4. Teilnehmer (UserCheck icon) → /teilnehmer
5. Räume (DoorOpen icon) → /raeume

Note: Anmeldungen is accessed from within Kurse context or via the primary action button, not as a separate tab (to keep mobile tabs at 5 max).

### Mobile-Specific Adaptations
- Hero is full-width, no side margins on the card
- Stats are horizontal scrollable pills instead of grid
- Course list cards stack vertically with 12px gap
- Chart is omitted on mobile to save space — the segmented bar in the hero provides the visual summary
- Bottom padding of 80px to avoid content hidden behind bottom nav

### Touch Targets
- All list items minimum 48px height
- Bottom tab icons 24px with 44px hit area
- Primary action button (FAB) is 56px circular, positioned bottom-right above the nav bar

### Interactive Elements
- Course cards tap to navigate to /kurse (filtered to that course)
- Anmeldung items tap to show detail in a bottom sheet

---

## 5. Desktop Layout

### Overall Structure
Two-column layout: 65% left / 35% right, with a max-width of 1400px centered.

**Eye flow:** Hero (top-left, spanning left column) → Quick stats (below hero, left) → Course chart (left) → Recent activity (right column, top) → Quick actions (right column).

### Section Layout

**Top area (full width):**
- Page title "Kursverwaltung" (28px, font-weight-800) with primary action button "Neue Anmeldung" on the right

**Left column (65%):**
1. **Hero Card** — Total Anmeldungen with payment bar (same as mobile but wider, number at 56px)
2. **Quick Stats Row** — 3 stat cards side by side (Aktive Kurse, Dozenten, Freie Plätze)
3. **Anmeldungen Trend Chart** — Bar chart showing registrations per course (horizontal bars, sorted by count descending). X-axis: count, Y-axis: course name. This answers "which courses are most popular?"

**Right column (35%):**
1. **Letzte Anmeldungen** — Last 8 registrations with participant name, course, date, payment badge
2. **Kurse mit freien Plätzen** — Courses that still have availability, with progress bar showing fill rate

### What Appears on Hover
- Course cards: subtle shadow increase + slight translateY(-1px)
- Table rows: muted background highlight
- Stat cards: slight shadow increase

### Clickable/Interactive Areas
- Course names → navigate to /kurse
- Participant names in recent list → navigate to /teilnehmer
- "Alle anzeigen" links on each section → navigate to respective page

---

## 6. Components

### Hero KPI
- **Title:** Anmeldungen gesamt
- **Data source:** Anmeldungen app (count all records)
- **Calculation:** Count of all Anmeldungen records
- **Display:** Large number (48px mobile, 56px desktop, font-weight-800) with segmented horizontal bar below showing bezahlt ratio
- **Context shown:** Bezahlt vs. Offen count, displayed as colored segments in horizontal bar + inline text
- **Why this is the hero:** The coordinator's #1 question every day is "how many enrollments do we have and are they paid?"

### Secondary KPIs

**Aktive Kurse**
- Source: Kurse app
- Calculation: Count of all Kurse records (or filter by date if startdatum <= today <= enddatum)
- Format: number
- Display: Compact stat card, 24px bold number, 12px muted label

**Dozenten**
- Source: Dozenten app
- Calculation: Count of all Dozenten records
- Format: number
- Display: Compact stat card

**Freie Plätze**
- Source: Kurse (maximale_teilnehmer) cross-referenced with Anmeldungen (count per kurs)
- Calculation: Sum of (maximale_teilnehmer - anmeldungen_count) for each Kurs
- Format: number
- Display: Compact stat card

### Chart
- **Type:** Horizontal bar chart — WHY: comparing course popularity is best done with named bars, and horizontal allows longer course names
- **Title:** Anmeldungen pro Kurs
- **What question it answers:** Which courses are most popular / filling up fastest?
- **Data source:** Anmeldungen grouped by kurs (applookup), joined with Kurse for names
- **X-axis:** Count of Anmeldungen
- **Y-axis:** Kurstitel (course name)
- **Colors:** Bars in primary color (indigo), with max capacity shown as a light background bar
- **Mobile simplification:** Hidden on mobile — the hero segmented bar provides the at-a-glance summary instead

### Lists/Tables

**Letzte Anmeldungen**
- Purpose: See most recent activity — who registered for what
- Source: Anmeldungen joined with Teilnehmer (name) and Kurse (title)
- Fields shown: Teilnehmer name, Kurstitel, Anmeldedatum, Bezahlt status (badge)
- Mobile style: Simple list with dividers
- Desktop style: Clean list in a card
- Sort: By anmeldedatum descending (newest first)
- Limit: 5 on mobile, 8 on desktop

**Kurse mit freien Plätzen (Desktop only sidebar)**
- Purpose: Quick view of which courses still have capacity
- Source: Kurse joined with Anmeldungen count
- Fields shown: Kurstitel, fill progress bar (enrolled/max), available spots count
- Desktop style: Compact list in card
- Sort: By available spots ascending (almost full first)
- Limit: 5

### Primary Action Button (REQUIRED!)
- **Label:** "Neue Anmeldung"
- **Action:** add_record
- **Target app:** Anmeldungen
- **What data:** Teilnehmer (select from existing), Kurs (select from existing), Anmeldedatum (date, default today), Bezahlt (checkbox, default false)
- **Mobile position:** fab (floating action button, bottom-right, 56px, above bottom nav)
- **Desktop position:** header (top-right, inline with page title)
- **Why this action:** Registering participants for courses is the #1 daily task for the coordinator

### CRUD Operations Per App (REQUIRED!)

**Kurse CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "+" button on /kurse page header opens Dialog. Fields: Kurstitel (text, required), Beschreibung (textarea), Startdatum (date), Enddatum (date), Maximale Teilnehmerzahl (number), Preis EUR (number), Dozent (select from Dozenten app), Raum (select from Räume app). Default: Startdatum = today.
- **Read:** Card list sorted by Startdatum (soonest first). Each card: Kurstitel, Beschreibung truncated, date range, Dozent name, Raum name, enrollment badge. Click card → Detail Dialog showing all fields + list of enrolled participants.
- **Update:** Pencil icon in detail view → same Dialog as Create, pre-filled with current values.
- **Delete:** Trash icon in detail view → Confirmation: "Möchtest du den Kurs '{titel}' wirklich löschen?"

**Räume CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "+" button on /raeume page header opens Dialog. Fields: Raumname (text, required), Gebäude (text), Kapazität (number).
- **Read:** Table with columns: Raumname, Gebäude, Kapazität. Click row → Detail Dialog.
- **Update:** Pencil icon in detail view or row → same Dialog as Create, pre-filled.
- **Delete:** Trash icon → Confirmation: "Möchtest du den Raum '{raumname}' wirklich löschen?"

**Dozenten CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "+" button on /dozenten page header opens Dialog. Fields: Vorname (text, required), Nachname (text, required), E-Mail (email), Telefon (tel), Fachgebiet (text).
- **Read:** Card grid (2 cols desktop, 1 col mobile). Each card: Full name, Fachgebiet badge, Email, Telefon. Click → Detail Dialog with all fields + list of their courses.
- **Update:** Pencil icon in detail/card → same Dialog as Create, pre-filled.
- **Delete:** Trash icon → Confirmation: "Möchtest du den Dozenten '{vorname} {nachname}' wirklich löschen?"

**Teilnehmer CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** "+" button on /teilnehmer page header opens Dialog. Fields: Vorname (text, required), Nachname (text, required), E-Mail (email), Telefon (tel), Geburtsdatum (date).
- **Read:** Table with columns: Name (Vorname + Nachname), E-Mail, Telefon, Geburtsdatum. Searchable by name. Click row → Detail Dialog with all fields + list of their enrollments.
- **Update:** Pencil icon → same Dialog as Create, pre-filled.
- **Delete:** Trash icon → Confirmation: "Möchtest du den Teilnehmer '{vorname} {nachname}' wirklich löschen?"

**Anmeldungen CRUD Operations**
- **Create:** Primary action "Neue Anmeldung" (FAB on mobile, header button on desktop). Dialog fields: Teilnehmer (select from Teilnehmer app, required), Kurs (select from Kurse app, required), Anmeldedatum (date, default today), Bezahlt (checkbox, default false).
- **Read:** Accessed via /kurse detail or dashboard. Table/list: Teilnehmer name, Kurs name, Anmeldedatum, Bezahlt badge. Sortable by date.
- **Update:** Pencil icon → same Dialog, pre-filled. Main use case: toggling bezahlt status.
- **Delete:** Trash icon → Confirmation: "Möchtest du die Anmeldung von '{teilnehmer_name}' für '{kurs_name}' wirklich löschen?"

---

## 7. Navigation (React Router)

### Navigation Structure
- **Navigation style:** Sidebar (desktop) + Bottom tabs (mobile)
- **Dashboard/Home route:** Overview KPIs, hero enrollment stats, recent activity, quick actions

### Routes

| Route | Page | Description |
|-------|------|-------------|
| `/` | Dashboard Overview | Hero KPI, quick stats, trend chart, recent anmeldungen |
| `/kurse` | Kurse | Full CRUD list of all courses with enrollment counts |
| `/dozenten` | Dozenten | Full CRUD card grid of all instructors |
| `/teilnehmer` | Teilnehmer | Full CRUD searchable table of all participants |
| `/raeume` | Räume | Full CRUD table of all rooms |

Anmeldungen are managed inline: from the dashboard FAB, from within Kurse detail views, and from a dedicated section on the dashboard. No separate /anmeldungen route needed — they are always in context of a Kurs or Teilnehmer.

### Navigation Design

**Desktop:**
- Fixed left sidebar, 260px wide, white background with border-right
- App logo/title "Kursverwaltung" at top with a small GraduationCap icon
- Nav items stacked vertically with icon + label
- Active item: indigo background (`--primary`) with white text
- Inactive items: muted-foreground text, hover shows muted background
- Sidebar is always visible (not collapsible)

**Mobile:**
- Fixed bottom tab bar, white background with border-top
- 5 tabs with icon (20px) + label (11px) stacked vertically
- Tabs: Übersicht, Kurse, Dozenten, Teilnehmer, Räume
- Icons: LayoutDashboard, GraduationCap, Users, UserCheck, DoorOpen

### Active Route Indicator
- Desktop: Active nav item has `bg-primary text-primary-foreground` with rounded-lg
- Mobile: Active tab icon and label in primary color, inactive in muted-foreground

### Dashboard Overview Page (/)
- Hero KPI (Anmeldungen + payment bar)
- 3 quick stat cards (Aktive Kurse, Dozenten, Freie Plätze)
- Anmeldungen pro Kurs chart (desktop only)
- Letzte Anmeldungen list
- Kurse mit freien Plätzen (desktop sidebar column)

---

## 8. Visual Details

### Border Radius
Rounded (8px) — `--radius: 0.5rem`. Cards and buttons feel modern but not overly playful.

### Shadows
Subtle — Cards: `shadow-sm` (0 1px 2px rgba(0,0,0,0.05)). On hover: `shadow-md` transition. The hero card has `shadow-md` by default to elevate it.

### Spacing
Normal to spacious — 24px gap between major sections, 16px gap between cards in a grid, 12px internal padding on compact elements, 24px on larger cards.

### Animations
- **Page load:** Stagger fade-in for cards (opacity 0→1, translateY 8px→0, 200ms, stagger 50ms)
- **Page transitions:** Fade (150ms opacity transition between routes)
- **Hover effects:** Cards lift with shadow-md + translateY(-1px), 150ms ease
- **Tap feedback:** Scale 0.98 on press, 100ms

---

## 9. CSS Variables (Copy Exactly!)

```css
  --radius: 0.5rem;

  --foreground: hsl(230 25% 15%);
  --card: hsl(0 0% 100%);

```

---

## 10. Implementation Checklist

The implementer should verify:
- [ ] Font loaded from URL above (Plus Jakarta Sans, weights 300-800)
- [ ] All CSS variables copied exactly from Section 9
- [ ] Mobile layout matches Section 4
- [ ] Desktop layout matches Section 5
- [ ] Hero element is prominent as described
- [ ] Colors create the warm academic mood described in Section 2

import { Routes, Route } from 'react-router'
import { Layout } from '@/components/Layout'
import { DashboardOverview } from '@/pages/DashboardOverview'
import { KursePage } from '@/pages/KursePage'
import { DozentenPage } from '@/pages/DozentenPage'
import { TeilnehmerPage } from '@/pages/TeilnehmerPage'
import { RaeumePage } from '@/pages/RaeumePage'

function App() {
  return (
    <Layout>
